@context.title: The JSON-LD Context for this document

@type.title: JSON-LD identifier for the document type
@type.description: This field is used to define the type of the document, and in this case should always be 'Status'.  MUST be present.

eTag.title: The current ETag for the Object
eTag.description: MUST be present if the repository enforces concurrency control

metadata.title: Information about the identifier/version of the Object's Metadata

eTag.title: The ETag for the Metadata
eTag.description: MUST be present if the server supports concurrency control

fileSet.title: Information about the identifier/version of the Object's FileSet

eTag.title: The Etag for the FileSet
eTag.description: MUST be present if the server supports concurrency control

service.title: The URL for the service to which this item was deposited (the Service-URL)
service.description: MUST be present.  This is the URL from which the client can retrieve information about the settings for the server that are relevant to this item (e.g. max upload sizes, etc)

state.title: List of states that the item is in on the server.
state.description: At least one state MUST be present, using the SWORD state vocabulary.  Other states using server-specific vocabularies may also be used alongside.

@id.title: Identifier for the state.
@id.description: MUST be present.  At least one such identifier MUST be from the SWORD state vocabulary.

description.title: Human readable description of the state

actions.title: Container for the list of actions that are available against the object for the client.

getMetadata.title: Whether the client can issue a request to retrieve the item metadata

getFiles.title: Whether the client can issue a request to retrieve any/all files in the item (both Binary Files and Packaged Content)

appendMetadata.title: Whether the client can issue a request to append the metadata of the item

appendFiles.title: Whether the client can issue a request to append one or more files (individually or via a package) to the item

replaceMetadata.title: Whether the client can issue a request to replace the item metadata.

replaceFiles.title: Whether the client can issue a request to replace files in an item.  This may be a single file or all of the files.

deleteMetadata.title: Whether the client can issue a request to delete all the item metadata.

deleteFiles.title: Whether the client can issue a request to delete files in the item.  This may be a single file or all files.

deleteObject.title: Whether the client can issue a request to delete the entire object.

lastAction.title: Container for information about the last action taken on the object by a client (not necessarily the current client).

timestamp.title: When the last action was taken by the client

log.title: Detailed log information about the last action
examples: description of the event that occurred, with any verbose information

treatment.title: Container for information about the treatment the item received in the last action

@id.title: URL for information about the treatment the item received

description.title: Description of the treatment the item received

links.title: List of link objects referring to the various files, both content and metadata, available on the object
links.description: MUST be present if there is one or more links available to the client

rel.title: The relationship between the resource and the object.
rel.description: MUST be present. Note that multiple relationships are supported.

packaging.title: The package format identifier if the resource is a package.
packaging.description: SHOULD, if the resource is a package

depositedOn.title: Timestamp of when the deposit happened
depositedOn.description: SHOULD be present if this is an Original Deposit

depositedBy.title: Identifier for the user that deposited the item
depositedBy.description: SHOULD be present if this is an Original Deposit

depositedOnBehalfOf.title: Identifier for the user that the item was deposited on behalf of.
depositedOnBehalfOf.description: SHOULD be present if this is an Original Deposit that was done On-Behalf-Of another user

byReference.title: The external URL of the location a By-Reference deposit was retrieved from
byReference.description: SHOULD be present if this is an Original Deposit that was deposited By-Reference, or is an active By-Reference deposit

status.title: The status of the resource, with regard to ingest.
status.description: SHOULD be present.  For example, packaged resources which are still being unpacked and ingested may announce their status here.  Likewise, by-reference deposits may do the same.  MUST be one of the allowed status URIs.  Any associated information to go along with the status, especially if the status is an error, SHOULD be in link[].log.  If no value is provided, the client MUST assume that the item is in the status: http://purl.org/net/sword/3.0/filestate/ingested

log.title: Any information associated with the deposit that the client should know.
examples: [any information associated with the deposit that the client should know]

derivedFrom.title: Reference to URL of resource from which the current resource was derived, for example, if extracted from a package that was deposited.
derivedFrom.description: SHOULD be present, if the resource is derived from another resource

dcterms:relation.title: URL to a non-sword access point to the file
dcterms:relation.description: MAY be present.  For example, the URL from which an end-user would download the file via the website.  This related URL does not need to support any of the SWORD protocol operations, and indeed may even be on a server or application which has no sword support.  Primary use case is to redirect the user to the web front end for the repository.

dcterms:replaces.title: URL to an older version of the file in the same Object, if this is also present as a resource.
dcterms:replaces.description: SHOULD be present, if an older version of the file is present

eTag.title: The eTag of the resource
eTag.description: MUST be present if the server supports concurrency control and the resource is available to the client to modify

dcterms:isReplacedBy.title: URL to a newer version of the file in the same Object, if this is present as a resource
dcterms:isReplacedBy.description: SHOULD be present, if newer version is present

versionReplacedOn.title: Date that the current resource was replaced by a newer resource
versionReplacedOn.description: SHOULD be present if dcterms:isReplacedBy is present

forwarding.title: List of other locations where the object is available.

@id.title: The SWORD identifier for the Object in the other system

links.title: List of links to the Object as it appears in the other system

@id.title: The URL of a representation of the Object in the other system

rel.title: The relationship to the Object that this URL has

contentType.title: The Content Type of the resource
